logicalRequirements.title: Logical Requirements
logicalRequirements.description: A logical condition that takes the form of equipment, tech, and flag requirements.

items.title: Logical element
items.description: Elements are assumed to be ANDed together, except when inside an OR object.

and.title: AND Logical Element
and.description: Fulfilled if all logical elements inside are fulfilled.

or.title: OR Logical Element
or.description: Fulfilled if at least one logical element inside is fulfilled.

not.title: NOT Logical Element
not.description: Fulfilled if the logical element given is not fullfilled.

type.title: Ammo Type
type.description: The type of ammo that must be spent

count.title: Ammo Count
count.description: The amount of ammo that must be spent.

ammoDrain.title: Ammo Drain Cost
ammoDrain.description: Always fulfilled, but if the ammo is present, it will be drained.

type.title: Ammo Type
type.description: The type of ammo that can be drained

count.title: Ammo Count
count.description: The amount of ammo that can be drained.

refill.title: Refill
refill.description: Always fulfilled, with an effect of fully refilling the listed resource types.

items.title: Resource Type
items.description: The name of a resource type that becomes fully refilled

enemyKill.title: Enemy Kill
enemyKill.description: Describes the need to be able to kill a set of enemies. By default, allows all non-situational weapons (provided they can damage the enemies)

enemies.title: Enemy Groups
enemies.description: An array of enemy groups that must be killed. All enemies in each group can be hit by the same attack from an area of effect weapon.

items.title: Enemy Group
items.description: A single group of enemies that can be hit by the same attack from an area of effect weapon.

items.title: Enemy Name
items.description: The name of an enemy, as found in the enemies file or the boss file.

explicitWeapons.title: Explicit Weapons
explicitWeapons.description: A list of weapons. If present, this list defines the only weapons that can be used to fulfill the EnemyKill logical element.

items.title: Weapon Name
items.description: The name of a weapon, as found in the weapons file.

excludedWeapons.title: Excluded Weapons
excludedWeapons.description: A list of weapons. If present, this list defines weapons that cannot be used to fulfill this EnemyKill logical element.

items.title: Weapon Name
items.description: The name of a weapon, as found in the weapons file.

farmableAmmo.title: Farmable Ammo
farmableAmmo.description: A list of ammo types that are considered farmable during this enemy kill. It voids all ammo costs for that type, unless superseded by a boss scenario.

items.title: Ammo Type
items.description: The name of an ammo type, which won't get spent (unless superseded by a boss scenario).

acidFrames.title: Acid Frames
acidFrames.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to spending a number of frames in acid.

gravitylessAcidFrames.title: Gravityless Acid Frames
gravitylessAcidFrames.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to spending a number of frames in acid, with Gravity Suit turned off, even if available.

draygonElectricityFrames.title: Draygon Electricity Frames
draygonElectricityFrames.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to spending a number of frames grapples to a broken Draygon turret.

enemyDamage.title: Enemy Dammage
enemyDamage.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to taking a number of hits from an enemy.

enemy.title: Enemy Name
enemy.description: The name of an enemy that damage must be taken from, as found in the enemies file.

type.title: Attack Type
type.description: The name of the enemy attack that damage must be taken from, as found in the enemy's list of attacks (in the enemies file).

hits.title: Number of Hits
hits.description: The number of hits that must be taken.

heatFrames.title: Heat Frames
heatFrames.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to spending a number of frames in a heat room.

gravitylessHeatFrames.title: Gravityless Heat Frames
gravitylessHeatFrames.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to spending a number of frames in a heated environment, with Gravity Suit turned off, even if available.

hibashiHits.title: Hibashi Hits
hibashiHits.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to taking a number of hits from Norfair flame pillars (called Hibashi).

lavaFrames.title: Lava Frames
lavaFrames.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to spending a number of frames in lava.

gravitylessLavaFrames.title: Gravityless Lava Frames
gravitylessLavaFrames.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to spending a number of frames in lava, with Gravity Suit turned off, even if available.

samusEaterFrames.title: Samus Eater Frames
samusEaterFrames.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that correlates to the number of frames captured by a Samus Eater.

metroidFrames.title: Metroid Frames
metroidFrames.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to spending a number of frames drained by a Metroid.

energyAtMost.title: Energy at Most
energyAtMost.description: Fulfilled by having Samus' energy drop to a maximum of this value, regardless of how much she had coming in.

autoReserveTrigger.title: Auto-reserve Trigger
autoReserveTrigger.description: Fulfilled by taking damage to trigger auto-reserves, which results in Samus' energy becoming equal to the initial reserve energy, and reserve energy becoming zero.

minReserveEnergy.description: Minimum energy in reserves which will satisfy this requirement

maxReserveEnergy.description: Maximum energy in reserves which will satisfy this requirement

spikeHits.title: Spike Hits
spikeHits.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to taking a number of hits from spikes.

thornHits.title: Thorn Hits
thornHits.description: Fulfilled by spending an amount of energy that corresponds to taking a number of hits from thorns (the less damaging spikes found mainly in Brinstar).

doorUnlockedAtNode.title: Door Unlocked at Node
doorUnlockedAtNode.description: Fulfilled by all Lock requirements, if any, on a Door Node being already unlocked.

obstaclesCleared.title: Obstacles Cleared
obstaclesCleared.description: Fulfilled by having all of the listed obstacles already cleared

obstaclesNotCleared.title: Obstacles Not Cleared
obstaclesNotCleared.description: Fulfilled by having all of the listed obstacles not cleared

resourceCapacity.title: Resource Capacity
resourceCapacity.description: Fulfilled by having at least the maximum capacity for all given resource types

count.title: Resource Count
count.description: The amount of resource capacity that Samus must have.

adjacentRunway.title: Adjacent Runway
adjacentRunway.description: DEPRECATED: Fulfilled by being able to come in via a specific door, if the door in the adjacent room has a runway that fulfills the other properties of this logical element. This logical requirement will be deleted; the strat property 'entranceCondition' should be used instead.

fromNode.title: From Node
fromNode.description: The in-room ID of the node through which the adjacent runway must be accessed.

usedTiles.title: Used Tiles
usedTiles.description: The number of effective tiles the runway in the adjacent room must have.

inRoomPath.title: In-Room Path
inRoomPath.description: The path of nodes that must have been followed by the player since entering the room in order for this adjacentRunway to be usable.

items.title: In-Room Path node
items.description: The ID of a node that is part of this path

physics.title: Appropriate Physics
physics.description: An optional array describing which physics are acceptable in order for this adjacentRunway to be usable. All physics are acceptable if this is missing.

items.description: A physics that is acceptable in order for this adjacentRunway to be usable.

useFrames.title: Use Frames
useFrames.description: An optional value that indicates a number of frames that Samus must spend at the adjacent runway. She should take appropriate damage according to that door's environment (acid/lava) and that room's environment (heat) when applicable.

overrideRunwayRequirements.title: Override Runway Requirements
overrideRunwayRequirements.description: An optional value that indicates whether logical requirements on the runway itself d be ignored. If missing, this should be interpreted as false.

canComeInCharged.title: Can Come in Charged
canComeInCharged.description: DEPRECATED: Fulfilled by being able to come into the room via a specific door, with a shinespark charge that has at least a number of frames remaining. This logical requirement will be deleted; the strat property 'entranceCondition' should be used instead.

fromNode.title: From Node
fromNode.description: The in-room ID of the node through which a shinespark charge must be carried.

inRoomPath.title: In-Room Path
inRoomPath.description: The path of nodes that must have been followed by the player since entering the room in order for this canComeInCharged to be usable.

items.title: In-Room Path node
items.description: The ID of a node that is part of this path

framesRemaining.title: Frames Remaining
framesRemaining.description: The number of frames that must be left on the shinespark charge when coming in.

unusableTiles.title: Unusable Tiles
unusableTiles.description: The number of contiguous tiles that are part of the runway but cannot be used to charge this shinespark.

canShineCharge.title: Can Shine Charge
canShineCharge.description: Fulfilled by being able to charge a shinespark under the described conditions.

usedTiles.title: Used Tiles
usedTiles.description: The number of contiguous tiles that are available to charge a shinespark.

gentleUpTiles.title: Gentle Up Tiles
gentleUpTiles.description: The number of tiles that slope gently upward (going up by half a tile).

gentleDownTiles.title: Gentle Down Tiles
gentleDownTiles.description: The number of tiles that slope gently downward (going down by half a tile).

steepUpTiles.title: Steep Up Tiles
steepUpTiles.description: The number of tiles that slope steeply upward (going up by a tile).

steepDownTiles.title: Steep Down Tiles
steepDownTiles.description: The number of tiles that slope steeply downward (going down by a tile).

startingDownTiles.title: Starting Down Tiles
startingDownTiles.description: The number of tiles that slope downwards at the start of a run, preventing the execution of a stutter.

openEnd.title: Number of Open Ends
openEnd.description: The number of open ends in the runway. An open end is a runway edge that ends in a dropoff rather than a wall. Each open end adds a bit of extra room.

shinespark.title: Shinespark
shinespark.description: Fulfilled by having sufficient energy to perform a shinespark lasting a given number of frames.

frames.title: Shinespark Frames
frames.description: The duration (in frames) of the shinespark that must be executed. This defines the energy cost of the shinespark assuming it is not interrupted by running down to 29 energy.

excessFrames.title: Excess Shinespark Frames
excessFrames.description: The shinespark duration (in frames) that is not required to complete the objective of the shinespark. Subtracting this from the `frames` defines the lower limit of the shinespark energy cost.

resetRoom.title: Reset Room
resetRoom.description: Fulfilled by entering the room in a specified node, and avoid visiting barred nodes.

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.description: The list of nodes from which entering the room is required to fulfill this logical element.

items.title: Node ID
items.description: The in-room ID of a node.

nodesToAvoid.title: Nodes to Avoid
nodesToAvoid.description: The list of nodes that must not have been visited since entering the room in order to fulfill this logical element.

items.title: Node ID
items.description: The in-room ID of a node.

mustStayPut.title: Must Stay Put
mustStayPut.description: Indicates that no other node but the entry node may be visited in order to fulfill this logical element. Must not be defined when it is intended to be false, unless there are no nodes or obstacles to avoid.

comeInWithRMode.title: Come in With R-Mode
comeInWithRMode.description: Fulfilled by being able to come into the room via one of a specific set of doors to obtain R-mode (not including G-mode). This implicitly requires the tech canEnterRMode as well as XRayScope and ReserveTank items.

fromNodes.title: From Nodes
fromNodes.description: A list of in-room node IDs, through one of which we must obtain R-mode (not including G-mode) in order to satisfy this logical element

items.title: From Node
items.description: The ID of a node through which we may obtain R-mode (not including G-mode) in order to satisfy this logical element

comeInWithGMode.title: Come in With G-Mode
comeInWithGMode.description: Fulfilled by being able to come into the room via one of a specific set of doors with G-mode (direct or indirect). This implicitly requires the tech canEnterGMode as well as XRayScope and ReserveTank items and a matching leaveWithGModeSetup (with non-zero reserve energy) or leaveWithGMode property on the neighboring door.

fromNodes.title: From Nodes
fromNodes.description: A list of in-room node IDs, one of which we must come in through with G-mode in order to satisfy this logical element.

items.title: From Node
items.description: The ID of a node which we may come in through with G-mode in order to satisfy this logical element.

mode.title: Mode
mode.description: Whether we must come in with direct G-mode, indirect G-mode, or either

artificialMorph.title: Artificial Morph
artificialMorph.description: Whether we must come in with artificial morph (also satisfied by having Morph collected)

mobility.title: Mobility
mobility.description: Whether Samus must come in mobile, immobile, or either.

itemNotCollectedAtNode.title: Item Not Collected
itemNotCollectedAtNode.description: Fulfilled by an item at a given node not having been collected yet.
